Details: Atenolol is used in the treatment of :
Dosage: Hypertension:50 to 100 mg a day administered ORALLY.Angina Pectoris:50 mg a day administered ORALLY. If an optimal response is not achieved within one week, the dosage should be increased to 100 mg a day administered ORALLY. Some patients may require a dosage of 200 mg a day administerd ORALLY for optimal effect.Acute myocardial infarction:5 mg IV over 5 min, administer second 5 mg IV dose 10 min later; if IV dose was tolerated, begin 50 mg ORALLY 10 min after last IV dose, then 50 mg ORALLY 12 h later, then 100 mg ORALLY once daily or 50 mg ORALLY twice daily for 6 to 9 further days.Cessation of Therapy in Patient with Angina Pectoris:If withdrawal of atenolol therapy is planned, it should be achieved gradually and patients should be carefully observed and advised to limit physical activity to a minimum.

Name: cetrorelix
Details: Cetrorelix is an antagonist to gonadotrophin-releasing hormone. As a component of ovarian stimulation regimens for assisted reproduction in infertility- cetrorelix is used to prevent luteinising hormone surges and premature ovulation. Other possible uses of cetrorelix includes in treating benign prostatic hyperplasia, malignant neoplasms of the prostate, endometriosis, and for uterine fibroids.

  Clobetasol is a super-high potency corticosteroid. Preparations containing clobetasol are indicated for the relief of the inflammatory and pruritic manifestations of corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses. Treatment beyond 2 consecutive weeks is not recommended, and the total dosage should not exceed 50 g per week because of the potential for the drug to suppress the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis. Use in pediatric patients under 12 years of age is not recommended.

Details:
Miclo is a preparation of clobetasone butyrate.

  Clobetasol is a super-high potency corticosteroid. Preparations containing clobetasol are indicated for the relief of the inflammatory and pruritic manifestations of corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses. Treatment beyond 2 consecutive weeks is not recommended, and the total dosage should not exceed 50 g per week because of the potential for the drug to suppress the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis. Use in pediatric patients under 12 years of age is not recommended.
